bioQuestions.answer: New Jersey is the best state in the US and Marty and I could easily take over the Northeast in a matter of milliseconds.

bioQuestions.question: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
bioQuestions.answer: A lotta people have like their first three to five interactions with people scripted.  You really don't start to know a person until meet up number 6.

bioQuestions.question: Who is your hero?
bioQuestions.answer: One time I was about to throw my retainer away in the Ratty, when a random girl, who had seen me take it out before I ate, said, "hey make sure you don't throw away your retainer."  So her.

bioQuestions.question: Do you want your child to be taller than you?
bioQuestions.answer: Eh its a hassle being this tall anytime I'm indoors, so it'd likely build character if they were.  I'm going with yes

bioQuestions.question: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
bioQuestions.answer: The threshold for True Love is unfortunately at the 5-minute-and-11-seconds mark, but once that is achieved, True Love is guaranteed

bioQuestions.question: What would you do for Trails if he was in a real pickle?
bioQuestions.answer:
1. Crack the jar/barrel/etc 
2. Drain the pickle juice 
3. Locate the pickle in which trails is stuck 
4. Extract trails from said pickle 
5. Eat pickle

bioQuestions.question: What do you do outside of BMo?
bioQuestions.answer: I've been a TA and HTA for numerous CS classes. I also like to read and play board games with my roommates.

bioQuestions.question: A recent movie you saw + review
bioQuestions.answer: Dune: stunning cinematography and design, nailed the feeling of how I imagined Dune, plot was a little underwhelming though

bioQuestions.question: A recent movie you saw + review
bioQuestions.answer: North by Northwest (Hitchcock Movie). I picked this movie out of the 326 offerings on the plane, and I wish I had picked something else. I had watched this move before when I was around 8 years old and I remember I loved it, but looking back that is probably only because I thought that escaping from criminals by climbing down Mt. Rushmore was the coolest thing in the world. The movie overall was solid (as all Hitchcock's are), but the ending of this one was especially outrageous and incomprehensible. 7/10

bioQuestions.answer: Luca (the Disney movie) is an unnervingly accurate documentary of Luca Duclos-Orsello’s secret Italian childhood, down to his frightening parents and communist sympathies. Pretty boring!

bioQuestions.question: As a team, we don't believe in love at first sight. What are your thoughts on love at five-minute, in-person, one-on-one conversation? Capital T, capital L.
bioQuestions.answer: I believe in “falling in love” like that, but I don’t think it’s True Love til you spend a lot of time together, know each other, and like internalize caring for each other to the point that you value them similarly to how you value yourself (think of how for some parents, their children are like their purpose and even more important than themselves)

bioQuestions.question: Are you satisfied with the amount of saliva you produce? Explain
bioQuestions.answer: Yes, actually. There must be benefits to producing saliva, though I cannot articulate said benefits. Therefore, I would not reduce the amount of saliva I produce. Meanwhile, I would not increase the amount, since I enjoy not spitting on people and stuff.

bioQuestions.question: You're an aging one-hit-wonder boy band frontman. One day, you get a call from Raja Gosnell, director of the Smurfs multimedia franchise. He wants your band to write the soundtrack for Smurfs 4: Smurfs Fight Back. Five years ago, you'd laugh in his face, but people are starting to forget you. Do you accept?
bioQuestions.answer: Smurf yes!

bioQuestions.question: Who from a combined roster of BMo and your immediate family would you trade to the Amish for a free trip to Lancaster, PA?
bioQuestions.answer: I would give up the whole team and my entire family just for a trip to Lancaster, PA

bioQuestions.question: What's the craziest thing you've done in the name of love?
bioQuestions.answer: Bought a $60 blanket for a girl I'd known for 2 weeks. We broke up not long after and I got nothing in return
